name: BrewingStandInventory
description: A specialized inventory helper that provides access to Minecraft brewing stand screen functionality. It allows interaction with potion brewing operations, fuel management, progress monitoring, and result previewing.
overview: The BrewingStandInventory represents the interface to a Minecraft brewing stand when its GUI is open. It provides access to brewing-specific operations such as checking if potions and ingredients can be brewed together, monitoring brewing progress, accessing individual potion/ingredient/fuel slots, and previewing brewing results before starting the process.

methods.name: isBrewablePotion
methods.description: Returns true if the given potion can be brewed in a brewing stand (i.e., it's a valid base potion or potion that can be modified), false otherwise.

parameters.name: potion
parameters.description: The potion item stack to check

methods.name: isValidIngredient
methods.description: Returns true if the given item is a valid brewing ingredient (e.g., nether wart, glowstone dust, redstone, gunpowder, etc.), false otherwise.

parameters.name: ingredient
parameters.description: The ingredient item stack to check

methods.name: isValidRecipe
methods.description: Returns true if the given potion and ingredient combination can be brewed together, false otherwise.

parameters.name: potion
parameters.description: The potion item stack to check

parameters.name: ingredient
parameters.description: The ingredient item stack to check

methods.name: previewPotion
methods.description: Returns the resulting potion item stack that would be created by brewing the given potion with the ingredient. If no recipe exists, returns the original potion unchanged.

methods.name: previewPotions
methods.description: Returns a list of all resulting potions from the current brewing input (all three potion slots with the current ingredient). Each item in the list corresponds to the result of brewing the potion in that slot.

methods.name: canBrewCurrentInput
methods.description: Returns true if the brewing stand can brew any of the currently held potions with the current ingredient, false otherwise. This checks if there's a valid ingredient, fuel, and at least one valid recipe.

methods.name: getFuelCount
methods.description: Returns the current amount of fuel remaining in the brewing stand. Each blaze powder provides 20 fuel units. Returns 0 when no fuel is remaining.

methods.name: getMaxFuelUses
methods.description: Returns the maximum fuel capacity of the brewing stand. This is always 20, representing the maximum fuel units a brewing stand can hold.

methods.name: getBrewTime
methods.description: Returns the time that the current potions have been brewing, in ticks. Returns 0 if no brewing is in progress.

methods.name: getRemainingTicks
methods.description: Returns the remaining time until the current brewing cycle completes, in ticks. Returns the full brew time (typically 400) if no brewing is in progress.

methods.name: getIngredient
methods.description: Returns the item stack in the ingredient slot (slot 3, top slot). This is where brewing ingredients like nether wart, glowstone dust, etc. are placed.

methods.name: getFuel
methods.description: Returns the item stack in the fuel slot (slot 4, bottom left). This is typically where blaze powder is placed for fuel.

methods.name: getFirstPotion
methods.description: Returns the item stack in the first potion slot (slot 0, left slot). This is where potion bottles are placed for brewing.

methods.name: getSecondPotion
methods.description: Returns the item stack in the second potion slot (slot 1, middle slot).

methods.name: getThirdPotion
methods.description: Returns the item stack in the third potion slot (slot 2, right slot).

methods.name: getPotions
methods.description: Returns a list containing all three potion slot item stacks (slots 0, 1, and 2). Empty slots will be represented by empty item stacks.
